CodeList.Name: Mechanical Circulatory Support Placement Timing

Description.TranslatedText: A terminology codelist to describe the timing of mechanical circulatory support placement.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: IN PLACE AT START OF PROCEDURE
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: In Place at Start of Procedure
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Mechanical Circulatory Support was in place at the start of the procedure.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Mechanical Circulatory Support in Place at Start of Procedure

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: INSERTED DURING A NON-PERCUTANEOUS CORONARY INTERVENTION PROCEDURE
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: Inserted during a Non PCI Procedure
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Mechanical Circulatory Support was inserted during a non-Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI) procedure.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Inserted During a Non-Percutaneous Coronary Intervention

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: INSERTED DURING PROCEDURE AND AFTER PERCUTANEOUS CORONARY INTERVENTION STARTED
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: Inserted during Procedure and after PCI Started
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Mechanical Circulatory Support was inserted during the procedure after Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI) started.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Inserted During Procedure and After Percutaneous Coronary Intervention Began

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: INSERTED DURING PROCEDURE BUT PRIOR TO PERCUTANEOUS CORONARY INTERVENTION
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: Inserted during Procedure but Prior to PCI
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Mechanical Circulatory Support was inserted during the procedure prior to percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI).
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Inserted During a Procedure but Prior to Percutaneous Coronary Intervention

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Mechanical Circulatory Support Placement Timing Terminology
